channel.description: Recent content in Regression on A Hugo website

item.title: Regression and classification tree
item.description: This is just to make the position. The downloaded version of the “Classification and Regression Trees” is very not clear. So I try to borrow one from university library. Then I will write some notes about this book here. This may not be fulfill very quick, but I hope so. Maybe this will be the first time to use the feature of r markdown, the package “rparts” description is implementing the algorithms in that book.

item.title: Natural cubic spline for Non-parametric regression
item.description: Here is the a new note about the non-parametric regression. Quote from the Green and Silverman(1994),1.2.2, there are many ways to quantify the roughness of a curve, which is means the how ‘rough’ or ‘wiggly’ the curve \(g\) is. An intuitively way is \(\int _a ^b \{g''(t)\}^2dt\),the integrated squared second derivative. The general form of penalized least squares regression \[S(g)=\sum^n_{i=1}\{Y_i-g(t_i)\}^2+a\int^b_a\{g''(x)^2\}dx\] So the fit is not only concern about the goodness of fit(if so,1-NN is the best method among all methods for the data set), but also consider about the roughness.

item.title: Test R markdown function
